intro: Echites jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican echites, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
